project.name: ember-audio
project.description: An Ember addon that makes working with the Web Audio API super EZ

Audio.name: Audio
Audio.description:
Provides classes that are capable of interacting with the Web Audio API's
AudioContext.

MusicalConcepts.name: MusicalConcepts
MusicalConcepts.description:
Provides helper classes that represent musical concepts meant to be used by
classes from the Audio module.

AudioHelpers.name: AudioHelpers
AudioHelpers.description:
Provides classes that interact with the Web Audio API indirectly by providing
data models for the classes in the Audio module to consume.

BeatTrack.name: BeatTrack
BeatTrack.description:
An instance of this class has a single "sound" (comprised of one or multiple
audio sources) but provides methods to play that sound repeatedly, mixed with
"rests," in a rhythmic way. An instance of this class behaves very similarly
to a "lane" on a drum machine.
todo:
need a way to stop a BeatTrack once it's started. Maybe by creating
the times in advance and not calling play until it's the next beat in the
queue?

Beat.name: Beat

Connection.name: Connection
Connection.description:
This class represents a single connection in a Sound instance's connections
array. It is mostly just a wrapper around an AudioNode instance. It defines
some standards for how to handle the behaviors of different AudioNode types.
Most connections create their corresponding AudioNode immediately, but some
AudioNodes are "throw-away" and have to be created each time a Sound instance
is played.

Most properties in this class just define how to go about getting/creating an
AudioNode instance and setting it on this class' `node` property. Some define
how to set properties on the AudioNode instance after it has been created.

Font.name: Font
Font.description:
Allows multiple Note instances to be loaded up and played via their
`identifier`.

LayeredSound.name: LayeredSound
LayeredSound.description:
Allows multiple instances of anything that uses
{{#crossLink "Playable"}}{{/crossLink}} to be loaded up and played at the
same time.

Note.name: Note
Note.description:
A class that represents a musical note, but does not carry any audio data.

This class only makes sense when used in the context of a collection, as the
only functionality it provides serves to facilitate identification.

Oscillator.name: Oscillator
todo: figure out why `isPlaying` isn't working for Oscillator

SampledNote.name: SampledNote
SampledNote.description:
Represents a musical note, created from sampled audio.
When a soundfont is created via the
{{#crossLink "Audio"}}Audio Service{{/crossLink}}, an instance of this class
is created for every musical note that is represented in a soundfont. This
class can be used for any collection of Sound instances where each instance
needs an awareness of what "musical note" it is (i.e. octave, accidental, etc..).

This class only makes sense when used in the context of a collection, as the
only functionality it provides over a
{{#crossLink "Sound"}}Sound{{/crossLink}}, serves to facilitate identification.

Sampler.name: Sampler
Sampler.description:
An instance of the Sampler class behaves just like a Sound, but allows
many {{#crossLink "AudioBuffer"}}AudioBuffers{{/crossLink}} to exist and
automatically alternately plays them (round-robin) each time any of the play
methods are called.
todo: humanize gain and time - should be optional and customizable

Sound.name: Sound
Sound.description:
The Sound class provides the core functionality for
interacting with the Web Audio API's AudioContext, and is the base class for
all other {{#crossLinkModule "Audio"}}{{/crossLinkModule}} types. It prepares
an audio source, provides various methods for interacting with the audio source,
creates {{#crossLink "AudioNode"}}AudioNodes{{/crossLink}} from the
connections array, sets up the necessary connections/routing between them,
and provides some methods to {{#crossLink "Sound/play:method"}}{{/crossLink}}
and {{#crossLink "Sound/stop:method"}}{{/crossLink}} the audio source.

Track.name: Track
Track.description:
A class that represents a "track" of music, similar in concept to a track on
a CD or an MP3 player. Provides methods for tracking the play position of the
underlying {{#crossLink "AudioBuffer"}}{{/crossLink}}, and pausing/resuming.
todo: move play override to _play so that all super.play methods work

Connectable.name: Connectable
Connectable.description:
A mixin that allows an object to create AudioNodes and connect them together.
Depends on `audioContext` being available on the consuming object.
todo:
figure out how to augment Ember.MutableArray so that the connections
array can have methods like addConnection

MusicalIdentity.name: MusicalIdentity
MusicalIdentity.description:
This mixin allows an object to have an awareness of it's "musical identity"
or "note value" based on western musical standards (a standard piano).
If any of the following are provided, all of the remaining properties will be
calculated:

1. frequency
2. identifier (i.e. "Ab1")
3. letter, octave, and (optionally) accidental

This mixin only makes sense when the consuming object is part of a collection,
as the only functionality it provides serves to facilitate identification.

Playable.name: Playable
Playable.description:
A mixin that allows an object to start and stop an audio source, now or in
the future, as well as track whether the audio source is currently playing or
not.

AudioService.name: AudioService
todo:
consider creating a class called something like EmberAudioLoadResponse
to use in place of current POJO returned from load().

might end up with lots
of sounds.

classitems.description: Determines the number of beats in a BeatTrack instance.
classitems.name: numBeats

classitems.description:
If specified, Determines length of time, in milliseconds, before isPlaying
and currentTimeIsPlaying are automatically switched back to false after
having been switched to true for each beat. 100ms is used by default.
classitems.name: duration

classitems.description:
Computed property. An array of Beat instances. The number of Beat instances
in the array is always the same as the `numBeats` property. If 'numBeats'
or duration changes. This property will be recomputed, but any beats that
previously existed are reused so that they will maintain their `active`
state.
classitems.name: beats

classitems.description: Calls play on all Beat instances in the beats array.
classitems.name: playBeats

params.name: bpm
params.description: The tempo at which the beats should be played.

params.name: noteType
params.description:
The (rhythmic) length of each beat. Fractions
are suggested here so that it's easy to reason about. For example, for
eighth notes, pass in `1/8`.

classitems.description:
Calls play on `active` Beat instances in the beats array. Any beat that
is not marked active is effectively a "rest".
classitems.name: playActiveBeats

params.name: bpm
params.description: The tempo at which the beats and rests should be played.

params.name: noteType
params.description:
The (rhythmic) length of each beat/rest. Fractions
are suggested here so that it's easy to reason about. For example, for
eighth notes, pass in `1/8`.

classitems.description: The underlying method behind playBeats and playActiveBeats.
classitems.name: _callPlayMethodOnBeats

params.name: method
params.description: The method that should be called on each beat.

params.name: bpm
params.description:
The tempo that should be used to calculate the length
of a beat/rest.

params.name: noteType
params.description:
The (rhythmic) length of each beat/rest that should
be used to calculate the length of a beat/rest in seconds.

classitems.description:
If `active` is `true`, all methods of play will cause this instance to play.
If `active` is `false`, the `playIfActive()` and `ifActivePlayIn()`
methods will treat this instance as a rest (a timed period of silence).
classitems.name: active

classitems.description:
Whether a Beat instance is currently playing, considering both active and
inactive beats (rests). When switched to `true`, is automatically returned
to false after the time specified by the duration property.
classitems.name: currentTimeIsPlaying

classitems.description:
Whether a Beat instance is currently playing, considering only active beats.
When switched to `true`, is automatically returned to false after the time
specified by the duration property.
classitems.name: isPlaying

classitems.description:
On Beat instance instantiation, this property should be set to the parent's
audioBuffer.duration.
classitems.name: _audioBufferDuration

classitems.description:
If specified, Determines length of time, in milliseconds, before isPlaying
and currentTimeIsPlaying are automatically switched back to false after
having been switched to true. 100ms is used by default.
classitems.name: duration

classitems.description:
Calls it's parent's `playIn()` method directly to play the beat in
`${offset}` seconds.

isPlaying and currentTimeIsPlaying are both marked true after the provided
offset has elapsed.
classitems.name: playIn

params.name: offset
params.description:
Number of seconds from "now" that the audio should
play.

classitems.description:
If the beat is marked `active`, calls it's parent's `playIn()` method
directly to play the beat in `${offset}` seconds.

If active, isPlaying is marked true after the provided offset has elapsed.

currentTimeIsPlaying is marked true after the provided offset has elapsed,
even if beat is not active.
classitems.name: ifActivePlayIn

params.name: offset
params.description:
Number of seconds from "now" that the audio should
play.

classitems.description:
Calls it's parent's `play()` method directly to play the beat immediately.

isPlaying and currentTimeIsPlaying are both immediately marked true.
classitems.name: play

classitems.description:
If `active`, calls it's parent's `play()` method directly to play the beat
immediately.

If `active`, isPlaying is immediately marked true.

currentTimeIsPlaying is immediately marked true, even if beat is not active.
classitems.name: playIfActive

classitems.description:
Sets `isPlaying` to `true` and sets up a timer that sets `isPlaying` back
to false after `duration` has elapsed.
classitems.name: _markPlaying

classitems.description:
Sets `currentTimeIsPlaying` to `true` and sets up a timer that sets
`currentTimeIsPlaying` back to false after `duration` has elapsed.
classitems.name: _markCurrentTimePlaying

classitems.description:
The name of the connection. This is the name that can be used to
get an AudioNode instance via the
{{#crossLink "Connectable/getNodeFrom:method"}}{{/crossLink}} method, or a
Connection instance via the
{{#crossLink "Connectable/getConnection"}}{{/crossLink}} method.
classitems.name: name

classitems.description:
If an AudioNode instance already exists and is accessible to the Sound
instance, the path to the node can be placed here. If this value is
specified, all options except `name` become useless. If `node` is specified,
it will override this option and the AudioNode supplied to `node` will be
used.
classitems.name: path

classitems.description:
If `createCommand` is specified, the object at this location (relative to
the Sound instance) will be used as the "source" of the `createCommand`.
classitems.name: source

classitems.description:
If `source` is specified, this method will be called on the object that was
retrieved from `source`. The value returned from this method is set on the
`node` property.
classitems.name: createCommand

classitems.description:
An array of POJOs that specify properties that need to be set on a node
when any of the {{#crossLink "Playable/play:method"}}{{/crossLink}} methods
are called. For instance, an
{{#crossLink "AudioBufferSourceNode"}}{{/crossLink}} must be created at
play time, because they can only be played once and then they are
immediately thrown away.

Valid keys are:

`attrNameOnNode` {string} Determines which property on the node should be
set to the value. This can be a nested accessor (ie. `'gain.value'`).

`relativePath` {string} Determines where on `this` (the Sound instance) to
get the value. This can be a nested accessor (ie. `'gainNode.gain.value'`).

`value` {mixed} The direct value to set. If used along with `relativePath`,
this will act as a default value and the value at `relativePath` will take
precedence.
classitems.name: onPlaySetAttrsOnNode

classitems.description:
Items in this array are set at play-time on the `node` via an exponential
ramp that ends at the specified time.

A convenience setter method called
{{#crossLink "Connection/onPlaySet:method"}}{{/crossLink}} exists for this
array and should be used unless it does not allow enough freedom for your
use-case.
classitems.name: exponentialRampToValuesAtTime

classitems.description:
Items in this array are set at play-time on the `node` via a linear ramp
that ends at the specified time.

A convenience setter method called
{{#crossLink "Connection/onPlaySet:method"}}{{/crossLink}} exists for this
array and should be used unless it does not allow enough freedom for your
use-case.
classitems.name: linearRampToValuesAtTime

classitems.description:
Items in this array are set at play-time on the `node` via an exponential
ramp that ends at the specified time.

A convenience setter method called
{{#crossLink "Connection/onPlaySet:method"}}{{/crossLink}} exists for this
array and should be used unless it does not allow enough freedom for your
use-case.
classitems.name: setValuesAtTime

classitems.description:
Items in this array are set immediately at play-time on the `node`.

A convenience setter method called
{{#crossLink "Connection/onPlaySet:method"}}{{/crossLink}} exists for this
array and should be used unless it does not allow enough freedom for your
use-case.
classitems.name: startingValues

classitems.description:
This is the main attraction here in connection-land. All the other
properties in the Connection class exist to create or mutate this property.
Houses an AudioNode instance that will be used by an instance of the Sound
class.

If this property is set directly, all of the other properties on this class
(except `name`) are rendered useless.
classitems.name: node

classitems.description:
If this is true, the AudioNode will be created every time the consuming
Sound instance is played.
classitems.name: createdOnPlay

classitems.description:
Allows an AudioNode's values to be set at a specific time
relative to the moment that it is played, every time it is played.

Especially useful for creating/shaping an "envelope" (think "ADSR").
classitems.name: onPlaySet

classitems.description:
Convenience method that uses
{{#crossLink "Connection/onPlaySet:method"}}{{/crossLink}} twice to set an
initial value, and a ramped value in succession.

Especially useful for creating/shaping an "envelope" (think "ADSR").
classitems.name: onPlaySet

classitems.description:
If any of the array types are null on init, set them to an
Ember.MutableArray
classitems.name: _initArrays

classitems.description:
Acts as a register for all the notes in the font. If null on instantiation,
set to `A()` via `_initNotes`.
classitems.name: notes

classitems.description: Plays a note from `notes`, given it's `identifier`.
classitems.name: play

params.name: identifier
params.description:
The identifier for the note that should be
played.

classitems.description: Gets a note from `notes`, given it's identifier.
classitems.name: getNote

params.name: identifier
params.description:
The identifier for the note that should be
returned,

return.description: The specified Note instance.

classitems.description: Sets `notes` to `A()` if null on instantiation.
classitems.name: _initNotes

classitems.description:
Acts as a register for different types of sounds. Anything that uses
{{#crossLink "Playable"}}{{/crossLink}} can be added to this register.
If not set on instantiation, set to `A()` via `_initSounds`.
classitems.name: sounds

classitems.description: Maps through objects in `sounds` and calls `play` on each
classitems.name: play

classitems.description:
Maps through objects in `sounds` and calls `playAt` on each, passing
through the `time` param to each sound.
classitems.name: playAt

params.name: time
params.description: The time to pass to each object's `playAt` method.

classitems.description:
Maps through objects in `sounds` and calls `playIn` on each, passing
through the `seconds` param to each sound.
classitems.name: playIn

params.name: seconds
params.description: The seconds to pass to each object's `playIn` method.

classitems.description:
Maps through objects in `sounds` and calls `playFor` on each, passing
through the `seconds` param to each sound.
classitems.name: playFor

params.name: seconds
params.description: The seconds to pass to each object's `playFor` method.

classitems.description:
Maps through objects in `sounds` and calls `playInAndStopAfter` on each,
passing through the `playIn` and `stopAfter` params to each sound.
classitems.name: playForIn

params.name: playIn
params.description:
Seconds to pass to each object's
`playInAndStopAfter` method.

params.name: stopAfter
params.description:
Seconds to pass to each object's
`playInAndStopAfter` method.

classitems.description: If `sounds` is null on instantiation, sets it to `A()`
classitems.name: _initSounds
type
frequency

classitems.description: Initializes default connections on Oscillator instantiation. Runs `on('init')`.
classitems.name: _initConnections

classitems.description: Creates a Connection instance with a filter of the specified type.
classitems.name: _createFilter

params.name: type
params.description: Determines what type of filter will be created.

return.description:
A connection with a BiquadFilterNode of the specified
type.

classitems.description:
Determines the Frequency for the lowpass filter. The lowpass filter is
disabled if this is not provided.
classitems.name: lowpassFrequency

classitems.description:
Determines the Frequency for the highpass filter. The highpass filter is
disabled if this is not provided.
classitems.name: highpassFrequency

classitems.description:
Determines the Frequency for the bandpass filter. The bandpass filter is
disabled if this is not provided.
classitems.name: bandpassFrequency

classitems.description:
Determines the Frequency for the lowshelf filter. The lowshelf filter is
disabled if this is not provided.
classitems.name: lowshelfFrequency

classitems.description:
Determines the Frequency for the highshelf filter. The highshelf filter is
disabled if this is not provided.
classitems.name: highshelfFrequency

classitems.description:
Determines the Frequency for the peaking filter. The peaking filter is
disabled if this is not provided.
classitems.name: peakingFrequency

classitems.description:
Determines the Frequency for the notch filter. The notch filter is
disabled if this is not provided.
classitems.name: notchFrequency

classitems.description:
Determines the Frequency for the allpass filter. The allpass filter is
disabled if this is not provided.
classitems.name: allpassFrequency

classitems.description:
Determines the Q for the lowpass filter. Has No effect if lowpassFrequency
is not set.
classitems.name: lowpassQ

classitems.description:
Determines the Q for the highpass filter. Has No effect if highpassFrequency
is not set.
classitems.name: highpassQ

classitems.description:
Determines the Q for the bandpass filter. Has No effect if bandpassFrequency
is not set.
classitems.name: bandpassQ

classitems.description:
Determines the Q for the peaking filter. Has No effect if peakingFrequency
is not set.
classitems.name: peakingQ

classitems.description:
Determines the Q for the notch filter. Has No effect if notchFrequency
is not set.
classitems.name: notchQ

classitems.description:
Determines the Q for the allpass filter. Has No effect if allpassFrequency
is not set.
classitems.name: allpassQ

classitems.description:
Determines the Gain for the lowshelf filter. Has no effect if
lowshelfFrequency is not set.
classitems.name: lowshelfGain

classitems.description:
Determines the Gain for the highshelf filter. Has no effect if
highshelfFrequency is not set.
classitems.name: highshelfGain

classitems.description:
Determines the Gain for the peaking filter. Has no effect if
peakingFrequency is not set.
classitems.name: peakingGain

classitems.description: Determines the gain applied to each sample.
classitems.name: gain

classitems.description: Determines the stereo pan position of each sample.
classitems.name: pan

classitems.description:
Temporary storage for the iterable that comes from the sounds Set.
This iterable is meant to be replaced with a new copy every time it reaches
it's end, resulting in an infinite stream of Sound instances.
classitems.name: _soundIterator

classitems.description:
Acts as a register for loaded audio sources. Audio sources can be anything
that uses {{#crossLink "Playable"}}{{/crossLink}}. If not set on
instantiation, automatically set to `new Set()` via `_initSounds`.
classitems.name: sounds

classitems.description: Gets the next audio source and plays it immediately.
classitems.name: play

classitems.description: Gets the next Sound and plays it after the specified offset has elapsed.
classitems.name: playIn

params.name: seconds
params.description:
Number of seconds from "now" that the next Sound
should be played.

classitems.description:
Gets the next Sound and plays it at the specified moment in time. A
"moment in time" is measured in seconds from the moment that the
{{#crossLink "AudioContext"}}{{/crossLink}} was instantiated.

params.name: time
params.description:
The moment in time (in seconds, relative to the
{{#crossLink "AudioContext"}}AudioContext's{{/crossLink}} "beginning of
time") when the next Sound should be played.

classitems.name: playAt

classitems.description:
Gets _soundIterator and returns it's next value. If _soundIterator has
reached it's end, replaces _soundIterator with a fresh copy from sounds
and returns the first value from that.
classitems.name: _getNextSound

classitems.description:
Applies the `gain` and `pan` properties from the Sampler instance to a
Sound instance and returns the Sound instance.
classitems.name: _setGainAndPan

return.description: The input sound after having it's gain and pan set

classitems.description: Sets `sounds` to `new Set()` if null on instantiation.
classitems.name: _initSounds

classitems.description:
When using the {{#crossLink "Audio-Service"}}{{/crossLink}}, The name that
this Sound instance is registered as on it's parent register.
classitems.name: name

classitems.description: The AudioBuffer instance that provides audio data to the bufferSource connection.
classitems.name: audioBuffer

classitems.description:
The parent
[AudioContext](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AudioContext)
instance that all audio events are occurring within. It is useful for
getting currentTime, as well as creating new
[AudioNodes](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AudioNode).

This is the object that facilitates and ties together all aspects of the
Web Audio API.
classitems.name: audioContext

classitems.description:
When a Sound instance plays, this is set to the `audioContext.currentTime`.
It will always reflect the start time of the most recent
{{#crossLink "Sound/_play:method"}}{{/crossLink}}.
classitems.name: _startedPlayingAt

classitems.description:
When a Sound instance is played, this value is passed to the
{{#crossLink "AudioBufferSourceNode/start:method"}}AudioBufferSourceNode.start(){{/crossLink}}
`offset` param. Determines `where` (in seconds) the play will start, along
the duration of the audio source.
classitems.name: startOffset
duration

classitems.description:
Computed property. Value is the amount of gain currently applied to the
`gain` connection from the `connections` array, formatted as a percentage.
classitems.name: percentGain

classitems.description: Gets the `panner` connection and changes it's pan value to the value passed in.

params.name: value
params.description:
The value, between -1 and 1 that the `panner` connection's
`pan.value` should be set to.

classitems.name: changePanTo

classitems.description:
Gets the `gain` connection and changes it's gain value to the value passed in.
returns a pojo with the `from` method that `value` is curried to, allowing
one to specify which type of value is being provided.

params.name: value
params.description:
The value that the `gain` connection's `gain.value` should
be set to. Can be a ratio, an inverseRatio or a percentage.

classitems.name: changeGainTo

return.description:
Intermediary POJO containing the `from` method which will
determine the type of value that `gain.value` is being set to and make the
change accordingly.

classitems.description:
Gets the bufferSource and stops the audio,
changes it's play position, and restarts the audio.

returns a pojo with the `from` method that `value` is curried to, allowing
one to specify which type of value is being provided.

params.name: amount
params.description: The new play position value.

classitems.name: seek

return.description:
Intermediary POJO containing the `from` method which will
determine the type of value that play position is being set to and make the
change accordingly.

classitems.name: position

classitems.description:
Computed property. Value is the current play position of the
audioBuffer, formatted as a percentage.
classitems.name: percentPlayed

classitems.description: Plays the audio source immediately.
classitems.name: play

classitems.description:
Pauses the audio source by stopping without
setting startOffset back to 0.
classitems.name: pause

classitems.description:
Stops the audio source and sets
startOffset to 0.
classitems.name: stop

classitems.description:
Sets up a `requestAnimationFrame` based loop that updates the
startOffset as `audioContext.currentTime` grows.
Loop ends when `isPlaying` is false.
classitems.name: _trackPlayPosition

classitems.description:
An array of Connection instances. Determines which AudioNode instances are
connected to one-another and the order in which they are connected. Starts
as `null` but set to an array on `init` via the
{{#crossLink "Connectable/initConnections:method"}} initConnections{{/crossLink}}
method.
classitems.name: connections

classitems.description:
returns a connection's AudioNode from the connections array by the
connection's `name`.
classitems.name: getNodeFrom

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the AudioNode that should be returned.

return.description: The requested AudioNode.

classitems.description: returns a connection from the connections array by it's name
classitems.name: getConnection

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the AudioNode that should be returned.

return.description: The requested Connection.

classitems.description: Find's a connection in the connections array by it's `name` and removes it.

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the connection that should be removed.

classitems.name: removeConnection

classitems.description: Initializes default connections on Sound instantiation. Runs `on('init')`.
classitems.name: _initConnections

classitems.description:
Observes the connections array and runs _wireConnections each time it
changes.
classitems.name: _watchConnectionChanges

classitems.description:
Gets the array of Connection instances from the connections array and
returns the same array, having created any AudioNode instances that needed
to be created, and having connected the AudioNode instances to one another
in the order in which they were present in the connections array.
classitems.name: _wireConnections

return.description:
Array of Connection instances collected from the
connections array, created, connected, and ready to play.

classitems.description:
Creates an AudioNode instance for a Connection instance and sets it on it's
`node` property. Unless the Connection instance's `createdOnPlay` property
is true, does nothing if the AudioNode instance has already been created.

Also sets any properties from a connection's `onPlaySetAttrsOnNode` array
on the node.
classitems.name: _createNode

params.name: connection
params.description:
A Connection instance that should have it's
node created (if needed).

return.description:
The input Connection instance after having it's node
created.

classitems.description:
Gets a Connection instance's `onPlaySetAttrsOnNode` and sets them on it's
node.
classitems.name: _setAttrsOnNode

params.name: connection
params.description:
The Connection instance that needs it's
node's attrs set.

return.description:
The input Connection instance after having it's nodes
attrs set.

classitems.description:
Meant to be passed to a Array.prototype.map function. Connects a Connection
instance's node to the next Connection instance's node.
classitems.name: _wireConnection

params.name: connection
params.description:
The current Connection instance in the
iteration.

params.name: idx
params.description: The index of the current iteration.

params.name: connections
params.description: The original array of connections.

return.description:
The input Connection instance after having it's node
connected to the next Connection instance's node.

classitems.description: For note `Ab5`, this would be `A`.
classitems.name: letter

classitems.description: For note `Ab5`, this would be `b`.
classitems.name: accidental

classitems.description: For note `Ab5`, this would be `5`.
classitems.name: octave

classitems.description:
Computed property. Value is `${letter}` or `${letter}${accidental}` if
accidental exists.
classitems.name: name

classitems.description:
Computed property. The frequency of the note in hertz. Calculated by
comparing western musical standards (a standard piano) and the note
identifier (i.e. `Ab1`). If this property is set directly, all other
properties are updated to reflect the provided frequency.

Computed property. Value is `${letter}${octave}` or
`${letter}${accidental}${octave}` if accidental exists. If this property
is set directly, all other properties are updated to reflect the provided
identifier.
classitems.name: identifier

classitems.description: Whether an audio source is playing or not.
classitems.name: isPlaying

classitems.description: Plays the audio source immediately.
classitems.name: play

classitems.description:
Plays the audio source at the specified moment in time. A "moment in time"
is measured in seconds from the moment that the
{{#crossLink "AudioContext"}}{{/crossLink}} was instantiated.

Functionally equivalent to {{#crossLink "Playable/_play:method"}}{{/crossLink}}.

params.name: time
params.description:
The moment in time (in seconds, relative to the
{{#crossLink "AudioContext"}}AudioContext's{{/crossLink}} "beginning of
time") when the audio source should be played.

classitems.name: playAt

classitems.description: Plays the audio source in specified amount of seconds from "now".
classitems.name: playIn

params.name: seconds
params.description:
Number of seconds from "now" that the audio source
should be played.

classitems.description:
Starts playing the audio source immediately, but stops after specified
seconds have elapsed.
classitems.name: playFor

params.name: seconds
params.description:
The amount of time after which the audio source is
stopped.

classitems.description:
Starts playing the audio source after `playIn` seconds have elapsed, then
stops the audio source `stopAfter` seconds after it started playing.
classitems.name: playInAndStopAfter

params.name: playIn
params.description:
Number of seconds from "now" that the audio source
should play.

params.name: stopAfter
params.description:
Number of seconds from when the audio source
started playing that the audio source should be stopped.

classitems.description: Stops the audio source immediately.
classitems.name: stop

classitems.description: Stops the audio source after specified seconds have elapsed.
classitems.name: stopIn

params.name: seconds
params.description:
Number of seconds from "now" that the audio source
should be stopped.

classitems.description:
Stops the audio source at the specified "moment in time" relative to the
"beginning of time" according to the `audioContext`.

Functionally equivalent to the `_stop` method.
classitems.name: stopAt

params.name: time
params.description: The time that the audio source should be stopped.

classitems.description:
The underlying method that backs all of the `stop` methods.

Functionally equivalent to the `stopAt` method.
classitems.name: _stop

params.name: time
params.description: The time that the audio source should be stopped.

classitems.description:
The underlying method that backs the
{{#crossLink "Playable/play:method"}}{{/crossLink}},
{{#crossLink "Playable/playAt:method"}}{{/crossLink}}, and
{{#crossLink "Playable/playIn:method"}}{{/crossLink}} methods.

Plays the audio source at the specified moment in time. A "moment in time"
is measured in seconds from the moment that the
{{#crossLink "AudioContext"}}{{/crossLink}} was instantiated.

Functionally equivalent to {{#crossLink "Sound/playAt:method"}}{{/crossLink}}.

params.name: time
params.description:
The moment in time (in seconds, relative to the
{{#crossLink "AudioContext"}}AudioContext's{{/crossLink}} "beginning of
time") when the audio source should be played.

classitems.name: _play

classitems.description:
An AudioContext instance from the Web Audio API. **NOT** available in all
browsers. Not available in any version of IE (except EDGE)
as of April 2016.
classitems.name: audioContext
todo: change this to audioContext to match other stuff
or change other stuff to audioContext

classitems.description:
This acts as a register for Sound instances. Sound instances are placed in
the register by name, and can be called via audioService.getSound('name')
classitems.name: _sounds

classitems.description:
This acts as a register for Sampler instances. Sampler instances are placed
in the register by name, and can be called via audioService.getSampler('name')
classitems.name: _samplers

classitems.description:
This acts as a register for soundfonts. A font is just a `Map` of Note
objects which is placed in this register by name, and can be played like:
`audioService.getFont('some-font').play('Ab1');`
classitems.name: _fonts

classitems.description:
This acts as a register for Track instances. Track instances are placed in
this register by name, and can be called via audioService.getTrack('name')
classitems.name: _tracks

classitems.description:
This acts as a register for BeatTrack instances. BeatTrack instances are
placed in the register by name, and can be called via
audioService.getBeatTrack('name')
classitems.name: _beatTracks

classitems.description:
Acts as a proxy method, returns a POJO with methods that return the _load
and _loadFont methods so that in the end. See example.
classitems.name: load

params.name: src
params.description:
The URL location of an audio file. Will be used by
"fetch" to get the audio file. Can be a local or a relative URL. An array
of URLs is required if a beatTrack is being loaded via `.asBeatTrack` or
`.asSampler`.

return.description:
returns a POJO that contains a few methods that curry
"src" "type" and "name" over to
{{#crossLink "Audio/_load:method"}}{{/crossLink}} and
{{#crossLink "Audio/_loadFont:method"}}{{/crossLink}} and allow you to
specify what type of Sound you'd like created.

todo: find a better way than returning a POJO

classitems.description:
Creates an array of Note objects from a json object containing notes and
frequency values.
classitems.name: createNoteArray

params.name: json
params.description:
Optionally provided json object. If not provided,
the object returned from utils/frequencyMap is used.

todo: allow createNoteArray to accept array of note names with no frequencies

classitems.description:
Creates a Sound instance with it's audioBuffer filled with one sample's
worth of white noise.
classitems.name: createWhiteNoise

params.name: opts
params.description: An object passed into the Sound instance.

return.description: The created white noise Sound instance.

classitems.description: Creates an Oscillator instance.
classitems.name: createOscillator

params.name: opts
params.description: An object passed into the Oscillator instance.

return.description: The created Oscillator instance.

classitems.description: Gets a BeatTrack instance by name from the _beatTracks register.
classitems.name: getBeatTrack

params.name: name
params.description:
The name of the BeatTrack instance that should be
retrieved from the _beatTracks register.

return.description:
Returns the BeatTrack instance that matches the
provided name.

classitems.description: Gets a Sound instance by name from the _sounds register
classitems.name: getSound

params.name: name
params.description:
The name of the sound that should be retrieved
from the _sounds register.

return.description: returns the Sound instance that matches the provided name.

classitems.description: Gets a Track instance by name from the _tracks register
classitems.name: getTrack

params.name: name
params.description:
The name of the Track instance that should be
retrieved from the _tracks register.

return.description: Returns the Track instance that matches the provided name.

classitems.description:
Gets a soundfont Map by name from the _fonts register and allows it to be
played via the returned POJO containing a method called `play`.
classitems.name: getFont

params.name: name
params.description:
The name of the Map that should be retrieved
from the _fonts register.

return.description:
Returns a POJO that has a `play` method which allows a
note from the requested font to be played.

classitems.description: Gets a Sampler instance by name from the _samplers register
classitems.name: getSampler

params.name: name
params.description:
The name of the sampler that should be retrieved
from the _samplers register.

return.description: returns the Sampler instance that matches the provided name.

classitems.description:
Gets all instances of requested type and calls
{{#crossLink "Sound/stop:method"}}{{/crossLink}} on each.
classitems.name: stopAll

params.name: type='tracks'
params.description:
The type of the register that you wish
to stop all instances of. Can be `'tracks'`, or `'sounds'`.

classitems.description:
Gets all Track instances and calls
{{#crossLink "Sound/pause:method"}}{{/crossLink}} on each. Only works for
tracks because only Track instances are pause-able.
classitems.name: pauseAll

classitems.description: Given a sound's name and type, removes the sound from it's register.
classitems.name: removeFromRegister

params.name: type
params.description:
The type of sound that should be removed. Can be
'sound', 'track', 'font', 'beatTrack', or 'sampler'.

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the sound that should be removed.

classitems.description: Gets a register by it's type.
classitems.name: _getRegisterFor

params.name: type
params.description: Which register to return.

classitems.name: _createSoundFor

params.name: type
params.description:
The type of
{{#crossLinkModule "Audio"}}Audio Class{{/crossLinkModule}} to be created.

params.name: props
params.description: POJO to pass to the new instance

classitems.description:
Loads and decodes an audio file, creating a Sound, Track, or BeatTrack
instance (as determined by the "type" parameter) and places the instance
into it's corresponding register.
classitems.name: _load

params.name: name
params.description:
The name that the created instance should be
registered as.

params.name: src
params.description:
The URI location of an audio file. Will be used by
"fetch" to get the audio file. Can be a local or a relative URL

params.name: type
params.description:
Determines the type of object that should be created,
as well as which register the instance should be placed in. Can be 'sound',
'track', or 'beatTrack'.

return.description:
Returns a promise which resolves
to an instance of a Sound, Track, or BeatTrack

classitems.description:
1. Creates a Font instance and places it in the fonts register.
2. Loads a soundfont file and decodes all the notes.
3. Creates a Note instance for each note.
4. Places each note on the font, using the note's identifier as key.
5. Returns a promise that resolves to an array of properly sorted Note
object instances.

The notes are sorted the way that they would appear on a piano. In the
example, you can see how the note `Ab1` from the `font-name` soundfont
would be played:
classitems.name: _loadFont

params.name: instrumentName
params.description:
The name that you will refer to this sound
font by.

params.name: src
params.description:
The URI location of a soundfont file. Will be used by
"fetch" to get the soundfont file. Can be a local or a relative URL.

return.description:
Returns a promise that resolves when the sound font
has been successfully decoded. The promise resolves to an array of sorted note names.

classitems.description: Creates a BeatTrack instance from an array of URLs.
classitems.name: _loadBeatTrack

params.name: name
params.description:
The name that this BeatTrack instance will be
registered as on the _beatTracks register.

params.name: srcArray
params.description:
An array of strings that specify URLs to load as
Sounds.

return.description: A promise that resolves to a BeatTrack instance.

classitems.description:
Accepts an array of URLs to audio files and creates a Sound instance for
each.
classitems.name: _createSoundsArray

params.name: name
params.description:
The base-name of the sound. If one were loading up
multiple kick drum samples, this might be 'kick'.

params.name: srcArray
params.description:
An array of strings. Each item being a URL to an
audio file that should be loaded and turned into a Sound instance.

return.description: A promise that resolves to an array of Sound objects.

classitems.description:
Takes an array of base64 encoded strings (notes) and returns an array of
arrays like [[name, audio], [name, audio]]
classitems.name: _extractDecodedKeyValuePairs

params.name: notes
params.description: Array of base64 encoded strings.

return.description:
Returns an Array of arrays. Each inner array has two
values, `[noteName, decodedAudio]`.

classitems.description:
Takes an array of arrays, each inner array acting as
a key-value pair in the form `[noteName, audioData]`. Each inner array is
transformed into a {{#crossLink "Note"}}{{/crossLink}} and the outer array
is returned. This method also sets each note on it's corresponding
instrument {{#crossLink "Map"}}{{/crossLink}} instance by name. Each note
is playable as seen in the example.
classitems.name: _createNoteObjectsForFont

params.name: audioData
params.description:
Array of arrays, each inner array like
`[noteName, audioData]`.

params.name: instrumentName
params.description:
Name of the instrument each note belongs to.
This is the name that will be used to identify the instrument on the fonts
register.

return.description: Returns an Array of {{#crossLink "Note"}}Notes{{/crossLink}}

classitems.description:
Given an array and an index, splits the array at index and pushes the first
chunk to the end of the second chunk.
classitems.name: arraySwap

params.name: arr
params.description: An array to split, shift and rejoin.

params.name: index
params.description: The index where the split should occur.

return.description: The swapped/shifted array.

classitems.description: Flattens an array of arrays into a shallow array.
classitems.name: flatten

params.name: arr
params.description: An array to flatten.

return.description: The flattened array.

classitems.description: Converts a base64 string into a Uint8Array of "binary" data.
classitems.name: base64ToUint8

params.name: base64String
params.description: The base64 string that you'd like to be converted.

return.description: A Uint8Array of converted "binary" audio data.

classitems.description:
Strips extraneous stuff from a soundfont and splits the soundfont into a JSON
object. Keys are note names and values are base64 encoded strings.
classitems.name: mungeSoundFont

params.name: soundfont
params.description: A soundfont as a long base64 string

return.description: A JSON representation of all the notes in the font

classitems.description:
Sorts an array of {{#crossLink "Note"}}Notes{{/crossLink}} so that they are in the same order that they would
appear on a piano.

params.name: notes
params.description: An array of notes that should be musically-sorted.

classitems.name: sortNotes

return.description: Array of musically-sorted notes.

classitems.description:
Takes an array of arrays of notes, determines the last note of
the first array, then splits the rest of the arrays in the array at the last
note of the first array, and moves the beginning of the array to the end
so that each array starts at the next note after the last note of the first
array, instead of at "A" (alphabetically).
example:
This is hard to explain. Here's an example.
    (Simplified, as the real notes are objects)

    Example input: [['A0', 'B0'], ['A1', 'B1', 'C1', 'D1']]
    Example output: [['A0', 'B0'], ['C1', 'D1', 'A1', 'B1']]
classitems.name: octaveShift

params.name: octaves
params.description: An array of octaves, each octave is an array of Notes.

return.description: Input array after having been shifted.

classitems.description:
Maps through an array of arrays and sorts each array with
"noteSort"
classitems.name: octaveSort

params.name: octaves
params.description: array of arrays to be sorted

return.description: array of sorted arrays

classitems.description:
Accepts an array of Note objects and passes back an array
like this: [original array, array of each octave in the orginal array]
classitems.name: extractOctaves

params.name: notes
params.description: array of note objects.

return.description:
array containing two inner arrays, [0] is the untouched input
array, [1] is an array of all the octaves in the original array.

classitems.description:
Accepts an array of two arrays and returns the same
array, but with array at index [1] uniq'd and sorted alphabetically.
classitems.name: stripDuplicateOctaves

params.name: notes, octaves
params.description: the output from extractOctaves.

return.description: The mutated array.

classitems.description:
Accepts an array of two arrays, [0] being an array
of Note objects, [1] being all the available octaves. Returns a single array
made up of arrays of Note objects, organized by octave. Each inner array
represents all of the notes in an octave.
classitems.name: createOctavesWithNotes

params.name: data
params.description: The output of stripDuplicateOctaves.

classitems.description:
Acts as a comparator function for the
{{#crossLink "Array/sort:method"}}Array.prototype.sort{{/crossLink}} method.
Sorts two {{#crossLink "Note"}}{{/crossLink}} instances alphabetically, flats
before naturals.
classitems.name: noteSort

params.name: a
params.description: The first Note instance to compare.

params.name: b
params.description: The second Note instance to compare.

return.description:
-1 or 1, depending on whether the current
{{#crossLink "Note"}}{{/crossLink}} instance should be sorted left, or right.

classitems.description: Formats a number and converts to string: 6 becomes '06'
classitems.name: zeroify

params.name: input
params.description: A number that should be formatted

return.description: The number formatted and converted to string
